intro: Corchorus erinaceus, commonly known as spiny sida, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its rough, spiny leaves and small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along riverbanks. Corchorus erinaceus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
